The Middle Kingdom of Egypt -LRB- also known as The Period of Reunification -RRB- is the period in the history of ancient Egypt between circa 2050 BC and 1710 BC, stretching from the reunification of Egypt under the impulse of Mentuhotep II of the Eleventh Dynasty to the end of the Twelfth Dynasty.

Some scholars also include the Thirteenth Dynasty of Egypt wholly into this period as well, in which case the Middle Kingdom would finish c. 1650, while others only include it until Merneferre Ay c. 1700 BC, last king of this dynasty to be attested in both Upper and Lower Egypt.

The Middle Kingdom  of     Egypt  is the     period  in the     history  of ancient     Egypt between circa 2050  BC and 1710      BC  ,  stretching from the     reunification      of     Egypt under the     impulse  of Mentuhotep      II  of the     Eleventh Dynasty  to the     end  of the     Twelfth Dynasty  .

Potential Answer Phrases:
The Middle Kingdom of Egypt 
the period in the history of ancient Egypt between circa 2050 BC and 1710 BC, stretching from the reunification of Egypt under the impulse of Mentuhotep II of the Eleventh Dynasty to the end of the Twelfth Dynasty

Some     scholars also include the Twelfth Dynasty wholly into this     period  as      well  ,    in which      case The  Middle Kingdom would finish  c.     1650  ,  while others only include  it  c. 1650 Merneferre      Ay  c. 1700      BC  ,  last     king  of the     Twelfth Dynasty  to  be attested  in both Upper and Lower     Egypt  .

 |          |         |        |     |     |       |      |     |    |         |     |        |    |    |    |         |       |       |       |      |     |     |       |    |    |      |        |        |       |     |     |        |               |   |   |            |   |   |              |       |     |             |       |     |   |     |      |   |      |       |      |             |    |  
Some     scholars    also   include the Twelfth Dynasty wholly into this     period  as      well  ,    in which      case    The    Middle Kingdom would finish  c.     1650  ,  while  others    only   include    it    c.   1650  Merneferre          Ay  c. 1700          BC  ,  last           king     of   the         Twelfth Dynasty  to  be attested  in both  Upper    and   Lower         Egypt  .

 TO     VB            PRP$        NN     ,     NNP      VBD         NN       IN  NN   ,    VBN       NN     NNS    ,   CC    VBN          NNS       RB     WRB      NNS     VBD         JJ    ,   CC    VBD      TO  DT        JJ     NN    ,     RB     IN     NN     TO    VB    DT           NNS       WP      VBD         PRP$          NN   . 
 |      |              |          |      |      |        |          |        |   |    |     |        |       |     |   |      |            |        |       |        |       |          |     |   |      |       |   |         |      |     |     |      |      |      |     |     |             |        |        |           |            |    |  
 To strengthen        his      position  ,  Amenemhet required registration  of land  ,  modified   nome  borders  ,  and appointed     nomarchs directly  when   offices  became     vacant  ,  but acquiesced  to the     nomarch system  ,  probably  in   order    to placate the         nomarchs   who   supported      his          rule  .

The     power  of the     Nomarchs seems  to drop off permanently during his      reign  ,  which has  been taken  to indicate that the central government had finally suppressed them Second Reporter  ,  some     kind      of     council  ,  and   a       staff  of the Nomarchs  '  officials and scribes though there  is   no     record that Senusret      II ever took direct     action against Second     Reporter  ,  some     kind      of     council  ,  and  a      staff  of minor officials and scribes  .

 to drop off permanently during his      reign  ,  which has  been taken  to indicate that the central government had finally suppressed them Second Reporter  ,  some     kind      of         council  ,  and   a      staff  of   the   Nomarchs  '  officials and scribes though  there      is     no         record that Senusret          II   ever  took direct         action against  Second         Reporter    ,    some         kind          of         council  ,  and  a           staff   of  minor  officials and scribes

Senusret   III        's name was Hellenized  by later      Greek  historians  as Sesostris    ,     a            name  which was     then   given    to    a          conflation  of Senusret   and   several   New   Kingdom warrior pharaohs  .

Ancient Egyptian sources regard these  as the first kings  of the     Thirteenth Dynasty  ,  though the  Thirteenth Dynasty  is  misleading  ,   as most     kings  of the      Thirteenth Dynasty were not related  .

Neferhotep      I  was even recognized  as the     suzerain  of the     ruler      of     Byblos  ,  indicating that the  Thirteenth Dynasty was  able  to retain much  of the     power  of the     Thirteenth Dynasty  ,   at      least  up  to his      reign  .

Potential Answer Phrases:

the individual Egyptian provinces, or Nomes,

The     title      of     Nomarch continued  to  be used until the     reign  of Senusret     III  ,   as  did  the elaborate tombs indicative  of  their     power  ,  after      which they suddenly disappear  .

While     it     is true that the large  tombs  indicative  of     nomarchs disappear  at the     end  of the         twelfth dynasty  ,  grand royal tombs    also   disappear soon      thereafter due   to general     instability surrounding the     decline  of the         Middle Kingdom  .

Block     statues consist  of  a      man squatting with  a      man squatting with his      knees drawn  up  to his      chest and his      arms folded  on top his      knees knees drawn  up  to  a      man squatting with his      knees drawn  up  to his      chest and his      arms folded  on top  his      knees chest and  a      man squatting with his      knees drawn  up  to his      chest and his      arms folded  on top his  knees arms folded  on     top  a      man squatting with his      knees drawn  up  to his      chest and his      arms folded  on top his      knees knees  .

The Middle Kingdom of Egypt 
The Middle Kingdom of Egypt 
the period in the history of ancient Egypt between circa 2050 BC and 1710 BC, stretching from the reunification of Egypt under the impulse of Mentuhotep II of the Eleventh Dynasty to the end of the Twelfth Dynasty
